comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From an upstairs room in the building on the right, the First & Last Hotel (an earlier building to the Tooths collection one), Charles Conder painted this same view in 1888. Charles Condor 'Departure of the 'Orient' - Circular Quay' (1888) AGNSW See also from the other direction: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2495797591/ [source: www.cultureandrecreation.gov.au/articles/heidelbergschool...]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: O M G ! - the more you look the more you find - I have a strong suspicion that the black ship at an angle on the left IS the SS Orient. Comparison photo (not easy with all those masts, spars, and cranes): nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn4404564 That particular wharf is called the "Orient Wharf" on the 1890 Sydney map (zoomable) - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm1280-s1-sd&rg...

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: There is also a bit of useful history of SS Orient here, including two good views: www.laird-bogstown.com/orient 1.php I think beachcomberaustralia has a good chance of being correct and that the ship at left could be SS Orient. On the topic of the Orient Line Wharf, you can see another reverse view of the wharf here: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362647029/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Good stuff, lifeasdaddy. I see that first site you mention also has a ticket from 1888 - it cost 16 pounds and 16 shillings Third Class, London to Australia - www.laird-bogstown.com/orient 2.php Great ship, great painting, and now this great photograph. Trifecta!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Another later (?) photo of the SS Orient (if I am not mistaken) without spars for some reason, at the same wharf but turned around. www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3041761855/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And again also by Henry King - a side view - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2554615575/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And again (not too sure of this one) - side view - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2363510276/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [Yawns!] See Persistent URL for this: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2533265460/ The SS Orient seems to have been a popular subject for these photographers, as well as for Charles Conder.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
The next day . . .
Some of these pictures may be of the SS Austral which sank in Neutral Bay in 1882 and was refloated - I am not (yet) expert enough to tell the difference.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I found another SS Orient photo, which may be the clearest yet - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2610196774/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: TEN SS Orient photos so far - www.flickr.com/search/?ss=2&w=24785917%40N03&q=ss...
